IFA 2015: Demand from exhibitors advances to new record
IFA confirms its position as the world´s leading trade show for Consumer Electronics and Home Appliances with 1,645 exhibitors and rented floor space totalling 150,000 square meters. Never before have so many exhibitors been welcomed by IFA on the Berlin Exhibition Grounds. Once again this event confirms its position as the world’s leading trade show for consumer electronics and home appliances.
The records point to continuing advances over IFA 2014, when orders amounted to 4.25 billion Euros – making IFA the leading platform for industry and retailers at the beginning of the peak annual sales period in the run-up to Christmas. No other event brings together so many retailers, buyers, trade visitors and media representatives at such an ideal time of year.
Market developments
The global Consumer Electronics market has expanded by 14 per cent, based on Euros. With the rate of exchange between Euro and US Dollars, market development is stable, keeping pace with last year’s figures. With the exception of central and eastern Europe, developments in every region around the world have been positive. In the home appliances sector, 2015 will also see a positive trend with growth reaching 4 per cent for major domestic appliances and six per cent for small domestic appliances.
“We expect IFA to have a positive and significant impact on the market. At IFA, the focus is on innovative products, new applications and solutions, as well as on forward-looking and fascinating trends and developments in the connected world. With its unique range of exhibits, IFA is a launching pad for successful business, innovative products are vital to growth – and they have debuted at IFA for more than 90 years“, said Hans-Joachim Kamp, chairman of the supervisory board of gfu Consumer & Home Electronics GmbH, the organisers of IFA.
“Growth in the global market for home appliances ranges from minus 35 to plus 17 per cent in various regions around the world, like in 2014. In 2015, we anticipate growth for the year as a whole“, said Dr. Reinhard Zinkann, Chairman of the Home Appliances Division at ZVEI. “As the world’s leading trade show for the home appliances industry IFA continues to occupy a trendsetting role.”
Dr. Christian Göke, CEO of Messe Berlin: “IFA is the industry’s global indicator, reflecting trends, the state of the economy and market developments. New products drive the markets. Our mission is to be the most significant and effective platform for the industry and retail in order to reach the consumer.“
Jens Heithecker, IFA Executive Director: “We are privileged to be able to work for an industry that has an unprecedented potential for innovation that reinvents itself daily. IFA is the only show that exhibits the entire range of new smart solutions. “
The IFA International Keynotes gather global CEOs and major international decision-makers from the fields of consumer electronics, home appliances and related industries, enabling them to share their for business and consumers visions.
Source:- IFA
